posts.post_content:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for [Liliana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana) & [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). Spike sees a [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain) with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.   
  
So many synergies, so little time.  
  
**Block**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Standard**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Extended**: [Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) with [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze)  
**Modern**: [Goryo's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goryo's Vengeance)  
**Legacy**: [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), [Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell)  
**Vintage**: [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids), [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Dance of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of the Dead)

posts.post_content: Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5

posts.post_content:
combos with [venser's journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=venser's journal). before your upkeep, pay 7 life, gain 7 cards. upkeep- gain 7 + how many cards were already in your hand life. swing for another 7 life, spend it for 7 cards, next upkeep gain 14+life (21+ if you could afford to pay again). [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) incase you deck yourself out. [Elixir of Immortality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elixir of Immortality) in case you have to discard everything, or even [Tamiyo, the Moon Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tamiyo, the Moon Sage)'s ultimate. stock up on zombies and play [rooftop storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rooftop storm) to drop a ton of creatures all at once.  
now just to find a way to reliably cheat griselbrand out in in standard.

posts.post_content: Whoa. Griselbrand actually makes a card like [Venser's Journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser's Journal) seem appealing. You pay 7 life to draw 7 cards, then you gain that life back plus whatever other cards you had in your hand and you don't have to discard any of them at the end of your turn? You can essentially be gaining massive card advantage and a lot more life if you play your cards right.

Posted By: Arachnos (1/20/2013 7:07:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Compare this directly to [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Yawgmoth's Bargain ) and you'll realize that it isn't that much less broken.  
  
It costs {B}{B} more, but nobody gives a shit because they can just cheat it out anyways.  
It can only draw in batches of 7, which, yes, is a significant downside, but it can heal you back, which is a significant upside.  
It can die easier because its a creature, but also it can deal damage because its a creature. Oh, and it has flying, so its especially good at that whole deal damage thing.   
  
It feels to me in a format with Reanimator and Entomb etc... this thing is just as deadly as the bargain.   
  
For the record, I think that although this thing is much more broken, its about 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000 times more fun to play than bargain, both with and against.
posts.html:

It can die easier because its a creature, but also it can deal damage because its a creature. Oh, and it has flying, so its especially good at that whole deal damage thing.

It feels to me in a format with Reanimator and Entomb etc... this thing is just as deadly as the bargain.

For the record, I think that although this thing is much more broken, its about 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000 times more fun to play than bargain, both with and against.

Posted By: Demonic_Professor (12/27/2012 3:04:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think, for what it gives you, it was somewhat well designed.  
  
The 1 card for 1 life model, as TheWrathofShane said, is broken. However, this forces you to draw in multiples of 7, similar to [Jin-Gitaxias](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jin-Gitaxias). Sometimes, you'll only want 2 or 3 cards, but you can't. Sometimes, you'll be at 6 life, and you can't. That's a problem.  
  
The ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) should be something people shouldn't look past. It, like [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator), forces you to go Mono-Black, which limits your card choices. Obviously, this a secondary reason why he's almost only used for reanimation.  
  
Truthfully, the best way to make him "Fair" is to make it "![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol) - Draw 7 cards and lose 7 life". The ability to do it multiple times and at instant speed is exactly what ruins him. It's a good thing he's banned in EDH. I know that facing him as a commander is NOT pretty.
posts.html:
I think, for what it gives you, it was somewhat well designed.

The 1 card for 1 life model, as TheWrathofShane said, is broken. However, this forces you to draw in multiples of 7, similar to Jin-Gitaxias. Sometimes, you'll only want 2 or 3 cards, but you can't. Sometimes, you'll be at 6 life, and you can't. That's a problem.

The should be something people shouldn't look past. It, like Phyrexian Obliterator, forces you to go Mono-Black, which limits your card choices. Obviously, this a secondary reason why he's almost only used for reanimation.

Truthfully, the best way to make him "Fair" is to make it " - Draw 7 cards and lose 7 life". The ability to do it multiple times and at instant speed is exactly what ruins him. It's a good thing he's banned in EDH. I know that facing him as a commander is NOT pretty.
